arm_group.description: Patients that were randomized to the the cardiac resynchronization therapy with defibrillation (CRT-D) device for the study
Patients that were randomized to the the implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD) device for the study

brief_summary.textblock:
The registry is designed to determine the long-term mortality and morbidity benefit as a
      result of Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy with Defibrillation (CRT-D) vs. Implantable
      Cardioverter Defibrillator (ICD) therapy in the MADIT-CRT study patient population. The
      registry will collect data on patients that previously participated at MADIT-CRT sites
      within Europe through five years of participation from their orginal enrollment in the
      MADIT-CRT IDE study.

clinical_study.brief_title: MADIT-CRT LONG-TERM INTERNATIONAL FOLLOW-UP REGISTRY - EUROPE

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Active patients who were enrolled in the MADIT-CRT IDE within Europe

        Exclusion Criteria:

        Patients who are unable or unwilling to comply with the protocol requirements

study_pop.textblock:
The registry involves only those patients that participated in the MADIT-CRT IDE study
        within Europe.

intervention.intervention_name: Patients that were randomized to the the cardiac resynchronization therapy with defibrillation (CRT-D) device for the study
intervention.other_name: Boston Scientific market approved cardiac resynchronization therapy defibrillators
Market approved Boston Scientific implantable cardioverter defibrillators

facility.name: Israeli Association for Cardiovascular Trials at Sheba Medical Center

reference.citation: Moss AJ, Hall WJ, Cannom DS, Klein H, Brown MW, Daubert JP, Estes NA 3rd, Foster E, Greenberg H, Higgins SL, Pfeffer MA, Solomon SD, Wilber D, Zareba W; MADIT-CRT Trial Investigators. Cardiac-resynchronization therapy for the prevention of heart-failure events. N Engl J Med. 2009 Oct 1;361(14):1329-38. Epub 2009 Sep 1.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of the  Israeli Association for Cardiovascular Trials

secondary_outcome.description: The combined end point of heart-failure or death, whichever came first.

collaborator.agency: Israeli Association for Cardiovascular Trials - IACT
